physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Plasma normetanephrine levels were mildly elevated at 1130 pmol/L (RR 0–900), plasma metanephrine levels were normal.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Plasma normetanephrine levels were previously elevated at 7770 pmol/L and 7680 pmol/L in past pregnancies but were normal during this assessment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: MRI demonstrated a large retroperitoneal mass surrounding the mesenteric vessels and encasing the superior mesenteric artery.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient had previously experienced high plasma-free metanephrines with an elevation to 10,115 pmol/L in a prior pregnancy.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: MRI scan revealed a 3.5 cm lesion compressing the inferior vena cava with significantly elevated plasma normetanephrine at 7770 pmol/L (RR 0–900).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient maintained normotensive throughout the pregnancy, indicating stability in blood pressure levels despite elevated normetanephrine.
